text: , also known as the Kawakami jinja, is a Japanese Shinto shrine in Saga, Saga Prefecture. ==History== Yodohime jinja was founded in the sixth century. It enshrines the kami of the grandmother of Emperor Jimmu. It was one of two chief Shinto shrine (ichinomiya) of Hizen Province and Saga Prefecture.Picken, Stuart. (2004). Sourcebook in Shinto: Selected Documents, p. 377; "Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 3 ; retrieved 2012-8-23. ==References== ==Other websites== * Yodohime jinja website Category:Shinto shrines in Saga Prefecture Category:6th-century establishments in Asia Category:Ichinomiya Category:Fuken-sha
title: Yodohime Shrine
